comment: text from paper: cells with orp2-T4A and also mutated at two additional (S/T)P sites (T1593A and S1623A) were also viable and healthy
alleles are described as part of complementation groups, and the used sequences are not mentioned
alleles are described as part of complementation groups, and the used sequences are not mentioned
D111 cannot be found in the paper sequence
P72 cannot be found in the paper sequence
text: "miss-sense mutation in the pmo25 ORF (TTT to GTT), which changed the Phe in position 205 to Val". Several TTT Phenylalanines around position 205, cannot tell which.
E136 is mentioned in the paper, but does not exist in the sequence
no N165 in sequence, two subsequent NN close by
I think the reference sequence might be a different allele
probably D232A, since no E is so close and all the rest of mutations are correct.
could be C22T at the nucleotide level? sequence is not mentioned in the paper.
there is no E at position 344. Position 344 is flanked by two Glutamates, so likely it's one of the two
no A at position 1399, and there are several surrounding alanines
no K711, most likely this refers to K710.
No N165, but there is a N156. I suspect that this could be scrambled numbers
oligonucleotides listed do not really align. They seem to be using a very different sequence. My guess it's maybe it refers to E132,D134 / D152,D154 / D159,D161
